title: SQL ServerSUBSTRING()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerSUBSTRING()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Extract 3 characters from a string, starting in position 1:
SELECT SUBSTRING('SQL Tutorial', 1, 3) AS ExtractString;

Definition and Usage
The SUBSTRING() function extracts some characters from a string.
Syntax
SUBSTRING(
string
,
start
,
length
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. The string to extract from
start
Required. The start position. The first position in
string
is 1
length
Required. The number of characters to extract. Must be a positive number
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Extract 5 characters from the "CustomerName" column, starting in position 1:
SELECT SUBSTRING(CustomerName, 1, 5) AS ExtractString
FROM Customers;

Example
Extract 100 characters from a string, starting in position 1:
SELECT SUBSTRING('SQL Tutorial', 1, 100) AS ExtractString;

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT SUBSTRING(CustomerName, 1, 5) AS ExtractString
FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerSUBSTRING()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerSUBSTRING()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerSUBSTRING()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
